intro: Bidens waimeana, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf structures. The plant typically grows in coastal and mesic habitats, showcasing adaptability to tropical climates. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Bidens waimeana plays a role in local ecosystems and is of interest for its ecological and botanical significance.
